issue.title: http doesnt work when running cron jobs

repository.name: cli
repository.description: ðŸ¥§ HTTPie CLI  â€” modern, user-friendly command-line HTTP client for the API era. JSON support, colors, sessions, downloads, plugins & more.

issue.body:
I have a cron job with "http -d "URL" and it doesnt work. however script works fine when executing manually.

how to fix it?

issue.title: http: error: Cannot use --output, -o with redirected output.

repository.name: cli
repository.description: ðŸ¥§ HTTPie CLI  â€” modern, user-friendly command-line HTTP client for the API era. JSON support, colors, sessions, downloads, plugins & more.

issue.body:
I suspect this might be closed as Invalid or Won't Fix, but I'm trying anyway.

Why can I not use `--output` and redirect the output of `http`? Doing so causes `http: error: Cannot use --output, -o with redirected output.`

I have tried all sorts of combinations of `--download` and `--output`, as well as `--ignore-stdin` suggested from https://github.com/jakubroztocil/httpie/issues/290, which is pointed to by https://github.com/jakubroztocil/httpie/issues/402, and I can't get anything to work.

I can't find anything in the docs that addresses this. Let's take a closer look:
```
  --output FILE, -o FILE
      Save output to FILE. If --download is set, then only the response body is
      saved to the file. Other parts of the HTTP exchange are printed to stderr.
```
```
  --download, -d
      Do not print the response body to stdout. Rather, download it and store it
      in a file. The filename is guessed unless specified with --output
      [filename]. This action is similar to the default behaviour of wget.
```

Instead of outputting the response body to stdout, it goes to a file. And the rest goes to stderr. Why shouldn't I be able to redirect stdout (which should have nothing) and stderr to a file?

Furthermore, it seems to imply that it is trying to mimic wget. But this works fine with wget.

Here are some more details comparing behavior in wget, curl, and http. First, I have scripts that download a file in each. Run with no output redirection, they work fine. All scripts start with `#!/bin/bash -ex`, so the output here is somewhat self documenting.

```
$ ./test-wget.sh
+ url=https://www.google.com/images/branding/googlelogo/1x/googlelogo_color_272x92dp.png
+ out_dir=./out
+ mkdir -p ./out
+ wget -O ./out/google-wget.png https://www.google.com/images/branding/googlelogo/1x/googlelogo_color_272x92dp.png
--2019-02-26 12:21:18--  https://www.google.com/images/branding/googlelogo/1x/googlelogo_color_272x92dp.png
Resolving www.google.com (www.google.com)... 172.217.0.36, 2607:f8b0:4005:802::2004
Connecting to www.google.com (www.google.com)|172.217.0.36|:443... connected.
HTTP request sent, awaiting response... 200 OK
Length: 5969 (5.8K) [image/png]
Saving to: â€˜./out/google-wget.pngâ€™

./out/google-wget.png                     100%[=====================================================================================>]   5.83K  --.-KB/s    in 0s      

2019-02-26 12:21:18 (36.4 MB/s) - â€˜./out/google-wget.pngâ€™ saved [5969/5969]

rich@rich16 [12:21:18 Tue Feb 26]:~/git/ll/users/rich/bugs/ra-7189/test
$ ./test-curl.sh 
+ url=https://www.google.com/images/branding/googlelogo/1x/googlelogo_color_272x92dp.png
+ out_dir=./out
+ mkdir -p ./out
+ curl -o ./out/google-curl.png https://www.google.com/images/branding/googlelogo/1x/googlelogo_color_272x92dp.png
  % Total    % Received % Xferd  Average Speed   Time    Time     Time  Current
                                 Dload  Upload   Total   Spent    Left  Speed
100  5969  100  5969    0     0  35264      0 --:--:-- --:--:-- --:--:-- 35319
rich@rich16 [12:21:23 Tue Feb 26]:~/git/ll/users/rich/bugs/ra-7189/test
$ ./test-http.sh 
+ url=https://www.google.com/images/branding/googlelogo/1x/googlelogo_color_272x92dp.png
+ out_dir=./out
+ mkdir -p ./out
+ http --download https://www.google.com/images/branding/googlelogo/1x/googlelogo_color_272x92dp.png --output ./out/google-http.png
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Accept-Ranges: bytes
Alt-Svc: quic=":443"; ma=2592000; v="44,43,39"
Cache-Control: private, max-age=31536000
Content-Length: 5969
Content-Type: image/png
Date: Tue, 26 Feb 2019 20:21:26 GMT
Expires: Tue, 26 Feb 2019 20:21:26 GMT
Last-Modified: Thu, 08 Dec 2016 01:00:57 GMT
Server: sffe
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block

Downloading 5.83 kB to "./out/google-http.png"
Done. 5.83 kB in 0.00111s (5.13 MB/s)
rich@rich16 [12:21:26 Tue Feb 26]:~/git/ll/users/rich/bugs/ra-7189/test
$ ls -l out
total 24
-rw-r--r-- 1 rich engr 5969 Feb 26 12:21 google-curl.png
-rw-r--r-- 1 rich engr 5969 Feb 26 12:21 google-http.png
-rw-r--r-- 1 rich engr 5969 Dec  7  2016 google-wget.png
rich@rich16 [12:21:34 Tue Feb 26]:~/git/ll/users/rich/bugs/ra-7189/test
$ file out/*.png
out/google-curl.png: PNG image data, 272 x 92, 8-bit/color RGBA, non-interlaced
out/google-http.png: PNG image data, 272 x 92, 8-bit/color RGBA, non-interlaced
out/google-wget.png: PNG image data, 272 x 92, 8-bit/color RGBA, non-interlaced
rich@rich16 [12:21:47 Tue Feb 26]:~/git/ll/users/rich/bugs/ra-7189/test
$ md5sum out/*.png
8f9327db2597fa57d2f42b4a6c5a9855  out/google-curl.png
8f9327db2597fa57d2f42b4a6c5a9855  out/google-http.png
8f9327db2597fa57d2f42b4a6c5a9855  out/google-wget.png
rich@rich16 [12:21:53 Tue Feb 26]:~/git/ll/users/rich/bugs/ra-7189/test
```

Trying again, but redirecting to a file, wget and curl work, but http results in a zero byte file:
```
$ rm -f -r out
rich@rich16 [12:26:03 Tue Feb 26]:~/git/ll/users/rich/bugs/ra-7189/test
$ ./test-wget.sh > test-wget.log 2>&1
rich@rich16 [12:26:51 Tue Feb 26]:~/git/ll/users/rich/bugs/ra-7189/test
$ ./test-curl.sh > test-curl.log 2>&1
rich@rich16 [12:27:10 Tue Feb 26]:~/git/ll/users/rich/bugs/ra-7189/test
$ ./test-http.sh > test-http.log 2>&1
rich@rich16 [12:27:21 Tue Feb 26]:~/git/ll/users/rich/bugs/ra-7189/test
$ ls -l out
total 16
-rw-r--r-- 1 rich engr 5969 Feb 26 12:27 google-curl.png
-rw-r--r-- 1 rich engr    0 Feb 26 12:27 google-http.png
-rw-r--r-- 1 rich engr 5969 Dec  7  2016 google-wget.png
rich@rich16 [12:27:25 Tue Feb 26]:~/git/ll/users/rich/bugs/ra-7189/test
$ file out/*.png
out/google-curl.png: PNG image data, 272 x 92, 8-bit/color RGBA, non-interlaced
out/google-http.png: empty
out/google-wget.png: PNG image data, 272 x 92, 8-bit/color RGBA, non-interlaced
rich@rich16 [12:27:32 Tue Feb 26]:~/git/ll/users/rich/bugs/ra-7189/test
$ md5sum out/*.png
8f9327db2597fa57d2f42b4a6c5a9855  out/google-curl.png
d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e  out/google-http.png
8f9327db2597fa57d2f42b4a6c5a9855  out/google-wget.png
rich@rich16 [12:27:37 Tue Feb 26]:~/git/ll/users/rich/bugs/ra-7189/test
```

I won't bother showing the logs of the successful (wget and curl) cases, they're basically the same as without the output redirection. Here's the log from the failed http case, showing the error:
```
$ cat test-http.log 
+ url=https://www.google.com/images/branding/googlelogo/1x/googlelogo_color_272x92dp.png
+ out_dir=./out
+ mkdir -p ./out
+ http --download https://www.google.com/images/branding/googlelogo/1x/googlelogo_color_272x92dp.png --output ./out/google-http.png
usage: http [--json] [--form] [--pretty {all,colors,format,none}]
            [--style STYLE] [--print WHAT] [--verbose] [--headers] [--body]
            [--stream] [--output FILE] [--download] [--continue]
            [--session SESSION_NAME_OR_PATH | --session-read-only SESSION_NAME_OR_PATH]
            [--auth USER[:PASS]] [--auth-type {basic,digest}]
            [--proxy PROTOCOL:PROXY_URL] [--follow] [--verify VERIFY]
            [--cert CERT] [--cert-key CERT_KEY] [--timeout SECONDS]
            [--check-status] [--ignore-stdin] [--help] [--version]
            [--traceback] [--debug]
            [METHOD] URL [REQUEST_ITEM [REQUEST_ITEM ...]]
http: error: Cannot use --output, -o with redirected output.

rich@rich16 [12:28:36 Tue Feb 26]:~/git/ll/users/rich/bugs/ra-7189/test
```

Trying again with `--ignore-stdin`, as suggested in the issues referenced above, does not help:
```
$ ./test-http-ignore-stdin.sh > test-http-ignore-stdin.log 2>&1
rich@rich16 [12:36:28 Tue Feb 26]:~/git/ll/users/rich/bugs/ra-7189/test
$ ls -l out
total 16
-rw-r--r-- 1 rich engr 5969 Feb 26 12:27 google-curl.png
-rw-r--r-- 1 rich engr    0 Feb 26 12:36 google-http-ignore-stdin.png
-rw-r--r-- 1 rich engr    0 Feb 26 12:27 google-http.png
-rw-r--r-- 1 rich engr 5969 Dec  7  2016 google-wget.png
rich@rich16 [12:36:40 Tue Feb 26]:~/git/ll/users/rich/bugs/ra-7189/test
$ cat test-http-ignore-stdin.log 
+ url=https://www.google.com/images/branding/googlelogo/1x/googlelogo_color_272x92dp.png
+ out_dir=./out
+ mkdir -p ./out
+ http --ignore-stdin --download https://www.google.com/images/branding/googlelogo/1x/googlelogo_color_272x92dp.png --output ./out/google-http-ignore-stdin.png
usage: http [--json] [--form] [--pretty {all,colors,format,none}]
            [--style STYLE] [--print WHAT] [--verbose] [--headers] [--body]
            [--stream] [--output FILE] [--download] [--continue]
            [--session SESSION_NAME_OR_PATH | --session-read-only SESSION_NAME_OR_PATH]
            [--auth USER[:PASS]] [--auth-type {basic,digest}]
            [--proxy PROTOCOL:PROXY_URL] [--follow] [--verify VERIFY]
            [--cert CERT] [--cert-key CERT_KEY] [--timeout SECONDS]
            [--check-status] [--ignore-stdin] [--help] [--version]
            [--traceback] [--debug]
            [METHOD] URL [REQUEST_ITEM [REQUEST_ITEM ...]]
http: error: Cannot use --output, -o with redirected output.

rich@rich16 [12:37:02 Tue Feb 26]:~/git/ll/users/rich/bugs/ra-7189/test
```

Is there some fundamental reason why the `--output` option couldn't be made to work with redirected output? It works fine for wget and curl, and this is IMHO a fairly annoying limitation.

At the very least, noting this in the docs for `--output` might be worthwhile.
